i Tracking commissions

commissions?

i Requirements for earning commission Gi

« Acharge can earn commission if:
iv) Policy is associated with a producer code, AND
iv) Commission plan for the producer code lists the charge pattern as a commissionable item
¢ Ifacharge can earn commission and has a charge breakdown:
* Only charge breakdown items that are flagged as commissionable earn commission

« For example: A Premium Including Taxes charge has two breakdown items:
+ Premium item (commissionable flag set)—commission can be earned

* Taxes item (commissionable flag not set)—commission cannot be earned

requirements in
commission plans
and subplans.

| Specifying different sets of commission rules Gi

¢« Acommission plan can have multiple subplans

« Each subplan specifies its own rules for rates, commissionable items, and event
that causes commission to be earned

Question G

,~ — Howwould you configure BillingCenter to pay different commission
: rates for different lines of business with the same producer?

¢
4

~- SSS 55555555 55=->=-=

Answer Gi

,~ — Howwould you configure BillingCenter to pay different commission
Pa rates for different lines of business with the same producer?
¢
There are two ways to do this: (1) Set up commission subplans that define different

criteria for different types of cases or (2) set up different producer codes.

Question G

_— — Howdoes BillingCenter determine which commission subplan applies to
: a given policy period?

¢
4

~- SSS 55555555 55=->=-=

Answer Gi

_— — Howdoes BillingCenter determine which commission subplan applies to
“ : a given policy period?

The conditional subplans have availability criteria, which BillingCenter checks against
the policy (LOB code), policy period (term number, assigned risk, state), and account
(evaluations, customer segments). If all the checks fail, the Default subplan is used.

~- SSS 5S 555555 5-5 =--=

Question G

,— — Whatis the role of the Default subplan?

¢
¢
4

~- SSS 55555555 55=->=-=

Answer Gi

,— — Whatis the role of the Default subplan?

¢
oo If no conditional subplans match the policy, BillingCenter uses the Default subplan.

~- SSS 5S 555555 5-5 =--=

Demonstration G

Create a commission subplan

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Determining when is commission earned Gi

¢ Earn Commissions field on the subplan controls when commission is earned

Payable Criteria

EamCommissions *[Onsiling -~i| + *-~«Earned all at once * Earned pro rata

On First Payment Rec'd

On Payment Rec'd * On Binding * On Billing
On Binding

* On First Payment Rec’d * On Payment Rec’d
On Effective Date

On Expiration Date * On Invoice Fully Paid

Custom

* Earned ona specified date - Logic determines timing
* On Effective Date * Custom
* On Expiration Date

Question G

_~ — When is commission earned?

¢
¢
4

~- SSS 55555555 55=->=-=

Answer Gi

_— — When is commission earned?

¢
: ‘ The timing of commission earning varies. It is determined by the Earn Commissions

setting on the commission subplan that is being used.

~- SSS 5S 555555 5-5 =--=

How to test a commission plan

Confguraion It is time to test our commission plan.

’ Testing involves creating a new policy
that has a producer code that points to
“ our commission plan. I'll show you.

Test the commission subplan

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Commission overrides Gi

Marcus
Business

Analyst Is it possible to override the
P commission rate or amount?

Marci
Configuration
Developer
Absolutely!
Let’s take a look.

Overriding commission on a policy Gi
¢ Fora policy, you can override the commission rate or select a different commission
plan
* Open the Commissions screen on the Policy tab and click Override Plan

Commissions

Override Commission Plan [swe tcommissions

Override Primary (Carr and Partners)

alternate Plan

Override Primary (E-506-C) Override Primary (E-506-C)
% | Alternate Plan ’ % | Percentage Y

*  CPO3

*\9

Overriding commission on a charge

¢ For acharge, you can override the commission rate or specify a flat commission
amount

Charges screen on the Account or Policy tab

Q Wiame Bly Smith Account# DENO00SS Nov3, 2021

Charges

Override Commission

For each Producer role, you can specify either a rate override or a flat amount override. You
are not allowed to specify both.

Date Charge Type > Policy > Amount Primary Producer Commission Rate >
11/03/2021 Prema covesumia stasean Gran 6.0%

Question G

ae boine commission overrides are available on the policy, on a charge, or

¢

Commi n plan

~- SSS 55555555 55-==-

Answer Gi

a bot, commission overrides are available on the policy, on a charge, or
, ?

Commission % is available on both; commission plan is available for the policy only;
commission amount is available for a charge only.

~- SSS 5555-55-54 =---
